questions.text: Inspissation is heating:

options.label: A
options.text: At 85 deg C for half an hour on 3 consecutive days

options.label: C
options.text: At 100 deg C for half an hour on 3 consecutive days

questions.correct_answer: A. At 85 deg C for half an hour on 3 consecutive days
questions.explanation: Ans. A) At 85 deg C for half an hour on 3 consecutive days

A patient admitted to an ICU is on central venous line for the last one week. He is on ceftazidime and amikacin. After 7 days of antibiotics, he develops a spike of fever and his blood culture is positive for gram positive cocci in chains, which are catalase negative. Following this, vancomycin was started but the culture remained positive for the same organism even after 2 weeks of therapy. The most likely organism causing infection is:

Patient is presented with cough with rusty sputum. On examination, lower lobe consolidation and bronchial breath sounds were heard. It gives a positive Quellung reaction. What is the probable Gram staining appearance?

A 65-years-old patient presented to the emergency with high grade fever, chest pain, increased respiratory rate and cough with expectoration. His sputum was sent to the laboratory for gram straining which showed the presence of pus cells and gram-positive cocci in pair. Which of the following will help in confirming the diagnosis?
In the following Gram stained specimen, identify the bacteria seen?

A 23-year-old female presents with fever and altered sensorium for two days with the following rash on legs. Her BP is 70/50 mm Hg and neck stiffness is present. Lumbar puncture reveals cloudy turbid CSF with 4200 cells/uL, Protein level 168 and Glucose of 21 mg/dL. Which of the following correctly describes the organism causing this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Gram Negative Diplococci (kidney shaped), Oxidase positive

options.label: B
options.text: Gram Negative Diplococci, ferments glucose and maltose

options.label: C
options.text: Gram Positive cocci catalase negative, bacitracin sensitive

options.label: D
options.text: Gram Positive Diplococci (lanceolate), catalase negative, optochin sensitive

questions.correct_answer: B. Gram Negative Diplococci, ferments glucose and maltose
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Gram Negative Diplococci, ferments glucose and maltose

questions.text: All are Koch’s postulates except:

options.label: A
options.text: A microorganism should be constantly associated with the lesions of the disease

options.label: B
options.text: It should be possible to isolate the bacterium in pure culture from the lesions

options.label: C
options.text: Inoculation of such pure culture into laboratory animals should reproduce the lesions

options.label: D
options.text: Administration of broad-spectrum antimicrobial agent dependably eradicates the organisms and cures the diseases

questions.correct_answer: D. Administration of broad-spectrum antimicrobial agent dependably eradicates the organisms and cures the diseases
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Administration of broad-spectrum antimicrobial agent dependably eradicates the organisms and cures the diseases

questions.text: An army jawan posted in remote forest area following a tick bite had fever and headache. His fever was 104 °F and pulse was 70 per min. He had an erythematous lesion of about 1 cm on the leg surrounded by small vesicles, along with generalized lymphadenopathy at the time of presentation to the referral hospital.
